title: Public transport urged for final
text:
Public transport urged for final 
Saturday 4 Jul 2015 12:20 p.m. 
Train, bus or boat is the best way to get to and from the sold-out Super Rugby final fans are being warned. 
The Hurricanes are facing off against the Highlanders with both teams competing to win the title for the first time. 
Extra seats have been added to boost capacity at Westpac Stadium to a sell-out crowd of 36,000 people. 
Fans should arrive early and take the train or bus to the stadium, Wellington City Council says. 
Extra flights, trains, buses and Eastbourne ferry services have been added to get fans to and from the match. 
Anyone driving should consider carpooling and allow at least 30 minutes to walk to the stadium, WCC says. 
Street closures: Bunny St taxi and public drop off at the railway station only Thorndon Quay and Featherston St closed for 30 minutes post-match No drop-off or pick-ups at the stadium. 
NZN
